item.title: Supporting your child when starting child care or kindy
item.description: It's natural to feel nervous about transitioning your baby or child into early childhood education. Knowing some settling techniques, as well as what you can advocate for on behalf of your child, can help their transition.

item.title: Summer festival-goers continue to abandon truckloads of camping gear
item.description: With campsite trash accounting for more than half of the rubbish accumulated at music festivals, there are calls for a "cultural shift" in the behaviour of those attending.

item.title: Australian Open: Iga Świątek plays down fitness concerns after Belinda Bencic loss in Poland's United Cup win
item.description: After two losses at the United Cup over the weekend, world number two Iga Świątek insists "everything is fine" with her fitness in the lead-up to the Australian Open.

item.title: National bulk-billing rates are increasing, according to Cleanbill report
item.description: The percentage of GP clinics fully bulk-billing has almost doubled, according to a new report, however, the government says the data cannot be relied on.

item.title: National domestic violence commissioner, legal services say Katherine court unsafe for women
item.description: Australia's domestic violence commissioner and local legal services have raised concerns about women's safety at Katherine Local Court, saying urgent upgrades are needed to protect victim-survivors.

item.title: Man allegedly wearing a vest covered in duct-taped objects in Bondi charged with offensive conduct
item.description: A man allegedly carrying a vest covered in duct-taped objects in Bondi has been arrested and charged by NSW Police, with his vest examined by the bomb disposal unit and deemed safe.

item.title: 'Extraordinary' number of clutches
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: High hopes for endangered white-throated snapping turtle after record number of clutches
item.description: A record number of clutches of white-throated snapping turtles have been found along the Burnett River in Queensland's Bundaberg region.

item.title: WA health report card exposes where the state is struggling most
item.description: The latest WA Health and Wellbeing report reveals how regions stack up when it comes to things like diet, smoking, exercise and mental health.

item.title: Alex Carey comforts daughter, top scores for Adelaide Strikers in BBL return loss to Perth Scorchers
item.description: After a sensational Ashes series, Alex Carey returns to Adelaide and the Big Bash with a bang, although it was a tougher night out for his daughter, Clementine.

item.title: NSW Police Inspector Amy Scott, praised for Bondi Junction stabbing response, diagnosed with breast cancer
item.description: NSW Police Inspector Amy Scott, who was praised for bringing the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing attack to an end, has been diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of breast cancer.

item.title: Iran's mass protests are not just about a repressive theocratic regime
item.description: Understanding how events unfold in Iran requires understanding how its society and economy have reconfigured in the 47 years since the Islamic revolution.

item.title: How I have fun with friends without spending money
item.description: I've kept low-cost, high-fun habits alive for years, even after returning home to a city where socialising often seems to mean shelling out.

item.title: Rose Byrne wins best comedy nod for If I Had Legs I'd Kick You, and other key moments from the Golden Globes
item.description: This year's Golden Globes saw hits and misses for Australia, last-minute snubs and a humbled Timothée Chalamet.

item.title: Federal minister backs decision to axe Palestinian author from Adelaide writers' festival
item.description: Resources Minister Madeleine King's comments come amid a growing furore over the decision that has led several board members to resign and dozens of writers to withdraw from the Adelaide literary event.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese recalls parliament to introduce hate speech and gun laws
item.description: Anthony Albanese has recalled parliament early to deal with sweeping hate speech and gun laws in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Herbal remedy ArmaForce causes severe reaction for Perth woman
item.description: A popular supplement linked to hundreds of adverse events is again in the spotlight after a Perth woman was hospitalised after taking over-the-counter herbal remedy ArmaForce.

item.title: Investigation underway after woman found dead at house in Buccan, south of Brisbane
item.description: An investigation is underway after a woman was found dead at a house in Buccan, south of Brisbane.

item.title: Labor pledges fertility treatment rebates as SA state election nears
item.description: Families will be able to access fertility treatment rebates of up to $2,000 per cycle for two cycles, under a Labor promise announced ahead of the upcoming state election.

item.title: Max Hobson identified as cattle farmer who died in Longwood fire near Seymour
item.description: Max Hobson has been identified as the person whose body was found metres from a car following the Longwood bushfire.

item.title: Imam thanks police after alleged roadside assault in Melbourne's south-east
item.description: An imam who was allegedly the victim of racial abuse during a roadside assault has thanked the police who helped him and his wife, and urged Australians to reject hate, Islamophobia and antisemitism.

item.title: Health expert says 'it's a mystery' why WA is falling behind eastern states on illegal tobacco laws
item.description: An eastern states public health expert says "it's a mystery" why Western Australia is lagging behind the rest of the country on updating its illicit tobacco laws.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Australian Open qualifying: Bernard Tomic cruises through first round against Hugo Dellier
item.description: Bernard Tomic looked in control throughout and comfortably moved his way into the second round of qualifying at Melbourne Park.

item.title: Couple heartbroken after new Harcourt home destroyed by Ravenswood fire
item.description: The couple was supposed to spend their first official night in the new home on Friday. It was destroyed by an out-of-control grassfire that afternoon.

item.title: The Gambia alleges Myanmar undertook a genocidal campaign against the Rohingya people at ICJ
item.description: The case is being watched closely to see how the court might handle other genocide allegations against Israel.

item.title: Locals devastated as coolstore cooperative destroyed by Harcourt fire
item.description: More than 90 businesses used the coolstore in the central Victorian town of Harcourt to store wine, beer, apples, and other produce. Now it's gone.

item.title: Geography quiz: How well do you know this wide, brown land?
item.description: How well do you know this wide, brown land?

item.title: First Venezuela, then the US Fed — what the White House attacks mean for us
item.description: In the past week, the US has dramatically expanded and accelerated its attacks both inside and outside its borders. Here's where Australia stands in the fray.

item.title: Japan's journey from unlicensed 'baby hotels' to delivering restaurant-quality childcare food
item.description: While Australia grapples with childcare scandals, Japan is delivering top-quality care with professional chefs serving up nutritious food. So how did they do it?

item.title: Elite female athletes speak out about struggles with body image and disordered eating
item.description: Throughout her career, former ice dancer Matilda Friend struggled with disordered eating and felt pressure to look a certain way. ABC's Women's Sport survey shows she isn't the only one.

item.title: Man faces court over fatal stabbing at Mount Druitt as police release CCTV of hooded men
item.description: Police have released CCTV of three men dressed in dark hoodies, who they believe can assist with inquiries.

item.title: Adelaide Writers' Week is in disarray — how did it reach this point?
item.description: The exclusion of novelist and academic Randa Abdel-Fattah from the upcoming Adelaide Writers' Week has prompted significant fallout in the form of withdrawals by other authors. Here's a look at how the events have unfolded, and how they could continue to.

item.title: Alyssa Healy retiring from all cricket after upcoming series against India
item.description: Australia captain Alyssa Healy announces she will retire from all forms of cricket after a multi-format series against India in February and March.

item.title: Details of Labor's new hate speech and gun laws revealed
item.description: Directly quoting from a religious text for the purpose of teaching or discussion may provide a defence under the federal government's hate speech laws proposed in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Thousands of ACT childcare documents show behind the scenes of embattled industry
item.description: Never-before-seen documents reveal reports of sexual abuse, inappropriate educator discipline, and children missing from ACT childcare centres.

item.title: Fears fish protection measures could threaten Eden Creek Weir platypus population
item.description: Landholders living alongside a northern NSW creek say a government plan to demolish a weir to improve fish migration will be devastating for the local platypus population.

item.title: British and Irish dual citizens bear costly brunt of UK passport changes
item.description: British Australian retiree Ian Fletcher is meant to be going on a seven-week holiday to the UK with his wife, Vicki, in April, but it may not go ahead due to passport changes.

item.title: Kevin Rudd to resign a year early as Australian ambassador to the US
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says it was Kevin Rudd's own decision to resign from the role on March 31, a year earlier than planned.

item.title: Global financial system hangs in balance as Federal Reserve independence challenged
item.description: A criminal probe into the US Federal Reserve chair threatens to undermine the US dollar and the global monetary system. Local analysts warn the implications for Australia are profound.

item.title: Adelaide Writers' Week director Louise Adler resigns following Randa Abdel-Fattah's removal
item.description: The director of Adelaide Writers' Week resigns after days of furore regarding a decision to cancel a scheduled appearance by a Palestinian-Australian author.

item.title: Alyssa Healy's path to Australian cricket greatness was far from straightforward
item.description: Alyssa Healy was thrust into headlines when she was just 16 for daring to break into a literal old boys' club, but has expertly handled the national spotlight with bat, ball and microphone in hand.

item.title: Regional NSW boy accused of hoax emergency calls about mass shootings at US institutions
item.description: A "young boy" from regional New South Wales is accused of making fake emergency calls claiming mass shootings were taking place at major retail and education institutions in the United States.

item.description: Australia's first openly gay male professional footballer, Josh Cavallo, has alleged his former club was homophobic, something it denies.

item.title: Record number of black and grey-headed flying foxes die during east coast heatwave
item.description: Wildlife rescuers warn extreme heat could kill more black and grey-headed flying foxes across NSW, with 700 dead animals already removed from two Illawarra camps.

item.title: Minnesota and the Twin Cities sue US federal government to stop immigration crackdown
item.description: Minnesota and its two cities sue the Trump administration in a bid to stop an immigration crackdown that led to the fatal shooting of Renee Good last week.

item.title: SA premier becomes emotional in press conference
item.description: Peter Malinauskas becomes tearful during a media conference where he faces extensive questions about the crisis surrounding Adelaide Writers' Week and allegations of homophobia against Adelaide United made by former player Josh Cavallo.

item.title: Rudd leaves US-Australia relationship in good shape ahead of Trump's China visit
item.description: One month after Kevin Rudd leaves his post as Australia's ambassador to Washington, Donald Trump will make his first presidential visit to China in almost 10 years.

item.description: Human rights groups estimate more than 500 people have been killed and more than 10,600 arrested in the ongoing protests.

item.title: Mount Alexander fire knocks out TV and radio across central Victoria
item.description: A fast-moving fire has silenced free-to-air TV and radio across central Victoria — and it could take months to fix the site.

item.title: Tasmanian pianist takes outdoor performances to striking mainland locations
item.description: Kelvin Smith played a baby grand piano at some incredible sites across Tasmania before bringing his impromptu shows to amazing mainland locations.

item.description: The woman who assaulted a former Northern Territory chief minister with a cream crepe is sentenced to 12 months imprisonment, fully suspended.

item.title: Bridge fire near tourist town of Byron Bay highlights region's homelessness crisis
item.description: A bridge used daily by thousands of drivers is shut in northern NSW, after a fire beneath it destroys the camps of two homeless men with "nowhere else to go".

item.description: The remaining members of the Adelaide Festival board will step down and this year's Writers' Week event has been cancelled, after days of furore regarding the decision to cancel a scheduled appearance by Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah.

item.title: Police say no ongoing threat to public safety, 18yo man in custody after Pinjarra firearms incident
item.description: Police say they have located an 18-year-old man wanted in connection with a firearms incident in Pinjarra on Tuesday morning.

item.title: l decluttered my wardrobe and said goodbye to 'fantasy me'
item.description: I was tired of trying to live up to an idealised version of myself. So, I decided to do something I had learnt from Marie Kondo: sort my wardrobe into what brought me joy and what didn't.

item.description: A motion-sensor camera has captured the rare sight of a koala in the wild at a wildlife sanctuary in Googong near the ACT border.

item.description: Some members of the Iranian diaspora in Australia are wary of foreign intervention in Iran, but others say there may not be another choice.

item.description: A WA mango grower is pleasantly surprised to find a crop full of massive mangoes, as big as a bowling ball.

item.description: It is the second year in a row Hewitt has been knocked out in the first round of qualifying, but the match against a much higher-ranked opponent can only do good things for him.

item.title: Neo-Nazi group National Socialist Network says it will disband due to proposed hate speech laws
item.description: In a statement posted to Telegram, the group announced the closure of the National Socialist Network would also spell the end of "co-projects" White Australia, the European Australian Movement and the White Australia Party.

item.description: One of Australia's most renowned authors, Craig Silvey, faces court after he allegedly distributed child exploitation material.

item.description: After being awarded a wildcard at the age of 45, seven-time major singles champion Venus Williams falls in the opening round in Hobart.

item.description: Residents in the central Victorian community of Ruffy say they are determined to rebuild after a bushfire destroyed most buildings in the small community.

item.description: Theatre makers Patrick Blenkarn and Milton Lim have built a game to be played socially in an auditorium, with a single player leading a group of donkeys on a journey of discovery.

item.description: A magistrate tells a 48-year-old bus driver prison is his "only possible sentence" after he lit two small fires near Sydney in December.

item.description: Yoon Suk Yeol faces several criminal charges related to his call to impose martial law and other criminal cases related to his time in office.

item.description: Loved by bushwalkers and tourists, a sacred Aboriginal site, and with weather conditions that can quickly deteriorate, Hobart's Kunanyi/Mount Wellington is a challenge to manage — and a government review of how that is done is being met with concerns.

Where does the festival go from here?

item.description: The ABC can reveal a neurosurgeon specialising in spinal surgery is among five people facing serious charges over a Queensland scheme allegedly involving kickbacks for medical devices.

item.title: There is now a strong likelihood Donald Trump will order his military option of choice on Iran

item.title: Iran warns of retaliation as US withdraws troops from Middle East bases
item.description: It comes as Iran's judiciary defies US warnings and says those detained over anti-regime protests could face execution, although the Iranian foreign ‌minister says there is no plan to hang people.

item.title: Some bookstores have pulled Craig Silvey's books from the shelves in response to child exploitation material charges against him.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australian Open One Point Slam winner Jordan Smith beats professional tennis players to take home $1 million
item.description: Sydneysider Jordan Smith has beaten grand slam champion Jannik Sinner and dual grand slam finalist Amanda Anasimova to take home the prize in the novelty format.

item.title: X to change AI chatbot after outrage over sexual deepfake images
item.description: New laws in the UK that would outlaw the generation of sexual deepfakes are set to come into force this week.

item.title: FBI raids home and seizes devices of Washington Post journalist
item.description: The reporter had previously reported on the Trump administration's efforts to fire hundreds of thousands of federal workers.

item.title: What it's like working at Casey Station in Antarctica
item.description: From 6,000 applications each year, only about 300 make the cut to travel down to Antarctica and experience a workplace like no other.

item.title: Can you guess how overdue and over budget these Grand Designs Transformations renovations were?
item.description: It's a familiar story on design shows. Home owners launch into building projects with budgets and timelines that don't always match their lofty ambitions. Take our quiz to measure your renovation planning skills.

item.title: Today in history, January 15: Australia's London Bridge fell down
item.description: Seconds after her cousin reassured her crossing it was safe, the famous Great Ocean Road formation started collapsing beneath Kelli Bryers's feet, setting off a terrifying ordeal.

item.title: Tens of thousands of livestock confirmed dead as Victorians return to bushfire-ravaged communities
item.description: Around 260 homes have been confirmed destroyed and 20,000 head of livestock killed by bushfires across Victoria, with authorities warning the total is likely to rise.

item.title: Sussan Ley signals Liberals won’t back 'unsalvageable' hate crime and gun control reforms
item.description: Liberals are backing away from a push to tackle antisemitism with stronger racial hatred laws, with some senior figures in the party also voicing freedom of speech concerns.

item.title: Ukraine's former PM Yulia Tymoshenko, formerly a rival to Volodymyr Zelenskyy, facing allegations of bribery
item.description: Anti-corruption watchdogs in Ukraine have searched the offices of the country's former prime minister Yulia Tymoshenko amid allegations of a major bribery scheme.

item.title: Who to see at Tamworth Country Music Festival 2026 — top artists and event details
item.description: Discover the must-see artists at the 2026 Tamworth Country Music Festival — from breakout stars like Lane Pittman to legends such as Felicity Urquhart. Your ultimate guide to shows, dates, and insider tips.

item.title: From inside Iran, a young protester says the people 'are waiting for America to intervene'
item.description: A defiant voice bravely breaks through Iran's internet blackout to detail the horrors she has witnessed and to tell the president of the United States "the people are waiting for America to intervene".

item.title: Severe thunderstorms and flooding to hit eastern seaboard in weather switch-up
item.description: Severe thunderstorms and flooding rain are expected to ease the short-term fire threat, while Queensland continues to be drenched from ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji.

item.title: Rental market growth stalls in some capital cities as household budgets stretched to limit
item.description: Australia's rental market is "starting to rebalance" with prices flat in some capital cities but affordability remains a concern, according to Domain, which says an annual salary of $100,000 is needed to live comfortably.

item.title: Writers' Week cancellation highlights SA premier's uneasy relationship with the arts
item.description: After backing the Adelaide Festival's decision to drop a Palestinian Australian author from Writers' Week, Peter Malinauskas is now trying to distance himself from a crisis that threatens to do untold damage to South Australia's festival reputation.

item.title: Jafar Panahi is ready to go to prison for the film the Iranian government doesn't want you to see
item.description: Would you face prison for what you believe in? Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi already has and, following the release of his latest film, he may again.

item.title: Reopening Gulgong Medical Centre a 'lifeline' for the community
item.description: Gulgong went 18 months without a GP clinic. It has now reopened, giving residents a reprieve from travelling hundreds of kilometres to see a doctor.

item.title: Controversial group Hizb ut-Tahrir says it 'cannot be banned' despite proposed laws targeting hate speech
item.description: Controversial group Hizb ut-Tahrir says the government "cannot ban" its ideas, despite its members facing the threat of jail under proposed hate speech laws to go before parliament.

item.title: Trauma medics warn over-60s against climbing ladders as 6,000 people hospitalised in a year
item.description: Thousands of people present to Australian hospitals each year for ladder and roof falls, with doctors urging caution — particularly for ageing Australians.

item.title: Trump to write next chapter of US relations with Iran after decades of tensions
item.description: From a CIA-led coup to a hostage crisis and air strikes, here are some of the defining moments in seven decades of relations between the United States and Iran.

item.title: Tree bark microbes play a role in eliminating greenhouse gases, study finds
item.description: Tiny, gas-eating microbes hidden in the bark of trees offer scientists a crucial clue in the fight against global warming.

item.title: Bark microbes removing greenhouse gases
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Denmark, US fail to agree over Greenland after high-level talks at White House
item.description: The United States and Denmark continue to disagree over the future of Greenland after a meeting at the White House amid ongoing threats from President Donald Trump threatening to seize the semi-autonomous Danish territory for national security reasons.

item.title: Residents near Mackenzie River on high alert as flood warning continues
item.description: Communities in Queensland's central highlands region remain on high alert today as major flooding continues along the Mackenzie River.

item.title: Victorian families warn of risks after hiring au pairs through social media
item.description: Families who turned to social media to find an au pair say the lack of safeguards left them vulnerable to serious problems.

item.title: NT set to fall short of Indigenous law and justice target despite early success
item.description: Despite the NT government signing on to establish 20 Aboriginal Law and Justice Groups by 2027, just five are up and running with less than 12 months to go.

item.title: Daniel Sanders suffers broken collarbone in Dakar Rally crash, losing lead but vows to ride on
item.description: Daniel Sanders says he has broken his collarbone and sternum in a crash on stage 10 of the Dakar Rally, but vows to finish the last three stages.

item.title: Live updates: Microsoft signs AI deal with ACTU, ASX to rise after Wall Street slides
item.description: Australia's peak union body moves to shore up tech, creative and media jobs, while the ASX is flat after another Wall Street slide. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: US to suspend immigrant visa processing for 75 countries, including Fiji
item.description: The US State Department will suspend processing of immigrant visas for people from 75 countries, including Fiji, Cambodia, Thailand, Somalia and Brazil, from January 21.

item.title: Volunteer firefighters, councils paying for Starlink connections as poor mobile reception continues across WA
item.description: Having repeatedly lost mobile coverage during recent bushfires, local councils and volunteer brigades are paying for expensive satellite units to maintain critical communications.

item.title: As Adelaide Writers' Week is cancelled, what is the future of writers' festivals in Australia?
item.description: The shock cancellation of Adelaide Writers' Week has left many concerned about the future of writers' festivals in an increasingly polarised political world.

item.title: Regulator investigates alleged breach of Alcoa's mining exemption conditions
item.description: WA's environmental regulator is investigating an alleged breach of Alcoa's state-imposed mining conditions which, if proven, would make it illegal for the company to continue some of its mining operations.

item.title: Australia's vet access deserts where an hour's drive is the difference in life and death
item.description: More than 250,000 people do not have ready access to a vet in Australia, and according to the industry it is not completely down to a shortage. It is also a distribution issue which is also putting biosecurity at risk.

item.title: Brisbane Heat beat Hobart Hurricanes in stunning BBL finish
item.description: A spectacular bowling effort in the final overs and a key contribution from Marnus Labuschagne help the Brisbane Heat to an upset win over the Hobart Hurricanes to keep their BBL finals hopes alive.

item.title: Alleged firebomber charged over arson attack on shop with suspected illegal tobacco links in South West
item.description: Organised Crime detectives have charged a Perth man in relation to an alleged arson attack on a convenience store with suspected ties to illegal tobacco in the state's South West.

item.title: Large glazed windows a popular design flaw in Australian apartments, expert says
item.description: Large glazed windows are a popular design flaw in Australian apartments, according to an expert.

item.title: Drought-hit grain growers make every drop of rain count
item.description: New techniques and technology are allowing southern NSW grain growers to produce a harvest, despite significantly below-average rainfall.

item.title: Police say 11 explosive devices found on Canberra streets
item.description: Eleven explosive devices have been found next to footpaths in the city's north-west in the past two days, ACT police say.

item.title: What is the next phase of the Gaza ceasefire deal?
item.description: With little fanfare, the White House has announced "phase two" of the Gaza ceasefire has begun — at least, in terms of how it views the situation with the war-ravaged territory.

item.title: Coalition asks Albanese for the grace he was not afforded in the wake of Bondi attack
item.description: Federal Liberals are discovering the price of having been so brazen in their politicisation of the Bondi terror attack and many appear to have buyers' remorse.

item.title: Why Alice Springs has become one of Australia's most prolific literary towns
item.description: With many local authors, Alice Springs is no longer just a setting for stories by writers from elsewhere. It is becoming one of Australia's most distinctive literary centres with homegrown talent inspired by the Red Centre's landscape.

item.title: Calls for greater transparency as WA government's annual reports into youth suicide delayed
item.description: Fearing more lives will be lost, Kimberley Aboriginal leaders call on the WA government to release updates on parliamentary and coronial recommendations into youth suicide.

item.title: Moment SpaceX spacecraft with sick astronaut undocks from ISS
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: SpaceX capsule begins return to Earth from International Space Station with sick astronaut on board
item.description: The Crew Dragon capsule has undocked from the International Space Station carrying four astronauts, one of whom has a "serious medical condition", and is on its way back to Earth.

item.title: Two French men to plead guilty over alleged $10m luxury theft in Canberra
item.description: Lawyers say the value of the allegedly stolen luxury goods, including a $5 million Richard Mille watch, is disputed as the case returns to court.

item.title: Adelaide Festival Corporation apologises to Randa Abdel-Fattah over Adelaide Writers' Week call
item.description: The Adelaide Festival Corporation, which oversees Adelaide Writers' Week, has apologised to Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah and says she will be invited to speak at its next event in 2027.

item.title: River Murray, Coorong, Lake Alexandrina listed as critically endangered
item.description: Environmental protections along a huge stretch of the River Murray will be boosted, following a decision to officially list the area as "critically endangered", the federal government says.

item.title: Stolen Generation artwork discovered in trunk of regional WA museum
item.description: An artwork drawn by a child of the Stolen Generations more than 70 years ago is discovered after decades in the trunk of a regional museum.

item.title: Workers on Melbourne farm supplying Woolworths, Coles chase unpaid wages worth $260,000
item.description: According to court documents, at least 20 workers are owed money for the work they did in late 2023 on Corrigan's Farm in south-east Melbourne, which experts say is part of a bigger problem that sees tens of millions in missing cash disappear into the black economy.

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Record crowds for 'Opening Week' leave some fans frustrated
item.description: The Australian Open has smashed attendance records in what is being marketed as "Opening Week", featuring fan events and qualifying matches, but the main draw does not start until Sunday.

item.title: Families displaced by Victorian bushfires face uncertain future in tight rental market
item.description: Four weeks after unpacking their last box, a Harcourt family fled fire with only their passports and clothes — and now face a difficult search for a new rental.

item.title: Jordan Smith on winning One Point Slam
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Who is Jordan Smith? The 1 Point Slam winner who beat Jannik Sinner
item.description: Jordan Smith comes from a tennis-mad family in Sydney and is now a millionaire thanks to a couple of days' work at the Australian Open.

item.title: From dumped shark heads to rising fury — how WA's demersal fishing ban turned ugly
item.description: Western Australia's ban on demersal fishing has left fishers frustrated. Will the government be able to soften the blow for an angry industry?

item.title: Australian Open 2026 live: Thanasi Kokkinakis withdraws as world's top players learn their fate in tournament draw
item.description: The Australian Open is almost here — but first we have the draw, which will determine the mouth-watering first round match-ups and what the possible finals could look like. Follow live.

item.title: How new passport rules for UK and Ireland dual citizens will work
item.description: Your guide to new UK and Ireland passport rules for dual citizens and general entry changes beginning in February.

item.title: Antonio Arena scores for Roma, raising questions over whether he will play for the Socceroos or Italy
item.description: In Italy, he has earned the nickname Il Baby Bomber because of his size, strength and impact on the game. But where do his international allegiances lie?

item.title: Neo-Nazi figure Joel Davis denied bail over alleged threat to federal MP
item.description: High-ranking neo-Nazi Joel Davis has told a Sydney court the Nationalist Socialist Network "no longer exists" as he was again denied bail for allegedly threatening a federal MP.

item.title: Tom Silvagni, son of AFL star, outlines rape conviction appeal grounds
item.description: Details of the 23-year-old's appeal bid have been released, with Silvagni arguing a judge erred in describing certain evidence as "incriminating conduct" during his rape trial late last year.

item.title: Blooming corpse flower at Adelaide Botanic Garden set to attract thousands
item.description: A corpse flower at the Adelaide Botanic Garden is generating excitement but it is actually among five of the rare plant to bloom in the city this summer.

item.title: WA health infrastructure audit delivers scathing assessment of hospital maintenance
item.description: An audit of WA's health infrastructure finds the state's aging public hospitals are too reliant on reactive maintenance, with no dedicated funding to keep them up to scratch and little data to inform future decisions.

item.title: Why Australia is investing in defence infrastructure at five military sites in the Philippines
item.description: Experts say these agreements are clear signs of how important an ally the Philippines is becoming in the Indo-Pacific region amid jitters of US security guarantees.

item.title: Emergency warning for Great Ocean Road as storm sweeps away cars
item.description: Cars have been swept to sea and residents isolated by floodwaters after more than 100 millimetres of rain was dumped in some parts of the popular holiday region.

item.title: Cars were seen being swept away follow torrential rain in Victoria
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Man charged over alleged social media death threats against PM Anthony Albanese, NSW Premier Chris Minns
item.description: WA Police charge a 19-year-old man after he allegedly uses social media to send messages, threatening to kill Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and NSW Premier Chris Minns.
